basics.name: Christine Nakano
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am a student studying for a B.S. in Computer Science in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawaii at Manoa. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2024.

courses: ICS 241: Discrete Math II for CS
ICS 141: Discrete Math I for CS

work.summary: Basic cashier work, packing, and making Korean desserts
highlights: Take orders, pack for customers, and make Korean-based desserts like lattes and bingsu

volunteer.summary: Founding member, former head programmer, currently a mentor
highlights: Made it all the way to the National Championships, had one of the highest programming scores in the State, and won many awards
Mentor and encourage future robotics team members to be more developed in the programming area

volunteer.summary: Advising, mentoring, and assisting with general computer science questions, issues or concerns

awards.title: Manoa Academic Merit Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarship is an automatic $2,000 scholarship per year for four years of undergraduate study for first-time degree seeking students. Students must have a 3.5 GPA, 1200 SAT or 23 ACT upon the time of application to UH Manoa.

awards.title: Foodland’s Shop For Higher Education: 2020 Scholarship Recipient
awards.summary: A total of one hundred $2,000 scholarships are given to deserving high school seniors across the state each year.

awards.title: 2021 UH Manoa Summer First-Year Merit Scholarship
awards.awarder: University of Hawai'i Manoa Outreach College
awards.summary: University of Hawaiʻi at Mānoa Outreach College is pleased to offer a $1,200 merit scholarship to up to 100 first-year UH Mānoa students for Summer Sessions 2021. This award recognizes academically exceptional students who have demonstrated a commitment to completing their UH Mānoa degree in four years.

awards.title: Dean's List
awards.summary: Undergraduate students are awarded the Dean's List distinction if they: (1) earn a semester grade point average of 3.5 or higher based on 12 credits or more taken for a grade (C/NC courses do not count), and (2) do not receive grades of W, I, F, or NC for that semester.
